meanings.definition: To be unsuccessful in achieving a goal or passing a test.
meanings.sent1: I fail to understand the math problem.
meanings.sent2: If you don't study, you will fail the exam.
meanings.sent3: I tried to bake a cake, but I fail at following recipes.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to win the race began to fail as she grew tired.
meanings.sent5: The rocket launch will fail if the countdown is not accurate.

meanings.sent1: Please don't fail to water the plants while I'm away.
meanings.sent2: If you fail to lock the door, the cat might escape.
meanings.sent3: I always fail to check the weather forecast before going out.
meanings.sent4: The detective could fail to notice a crucial clue in the investigation.
meanings.sent5: If you fail to charge your phone, it will run out of battery.

meanings.definition: To break down; cease to function.
meanings.sent1: The old car may fail to start in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: If the power goes out, the lights will fail to turn on.
meanings.sent3: The robot might fail to operate if its batteries are low.
meanings.sent4: The bridge could fail under the weight of too many cars.
meanings.sent5: The clock will fail to tick if the mechanism is damaged.
